Job Title: Integrated Media Planner 

Location: Greater Boston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Advertising, Marketing

Description:
Come work with us in our Boston or Manchester location. We work 2 days in the office on Tuesday & Thursday, and 3 days you can work from anywhere on Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
The Integrated Media Planner is responsible for helping to drive media strategy, research and planning across key accounts, in addition to campaign creation and optimization. Working closely with the Associate Media Director and Media Supervisor, the Integrated Media Planner will make strategic recommendations for media spend allocation, see plans through to completion and ensure that campaigns are launched properly and optimized towards efficiency and effectiveness in achieving KPIs. The Integrated Media planner works closely with the Associate Media Director and participates in plan presentations to clients
WHO YOU AREPositive, flexible, and curiousSelf-starter looking to grow and take on new challengesExcited about innovation in media and creative problem solving
LEADERSHIPResponsible for staying on top of latest media trends, technologies and ad platforms and sharing information with larger team/educate; Must have a passion for exploring cutting edge media platformsMust embrace uncertainty/change and thrive on the challenge of doing something newMaintain the agency’s core values, professional standards Develop and nurture media partner relationships
RESPONSIBILITIESWork collaboratively with integrated media team across all traditional (TV, Radio, Print, OOH) and digital (programmatic, SEM, ecommerce, organic and paid social, influencers) media to support the development and execution of media plans by helping to:Select media channels and make recommendations based on client campaign goalsUnderstand the pros/cons of each media type and how that relates to individual client strategies (traditional and digital media)Evaluate media kit information, client proposals and costs; Provide POVsNegotiate rates and makegoods as neededManage 1-2 smaller media accounts with minimal supervisionDevelop and manage media flowcharts and budget allocation/reconciliationMonitor campaign pacing – ensuring TV/Radio/Print spots/ads run as planned; optimization of digital occurs throughout duration Monitor, analyze, optimize, and educate based on campaign performance with recommendations on inventory, channel and creative shifts; stay abreast of reporting schedules established using the Tableau dashboard to create client reportsManage influencer relationships from discovery through deliveryCoordinate with creative and account services to schedule promoted posts and oversee community management on organic social contentCollaborate with account, production, and data/analytics teams for creative rotation and production team for deadlines and specs, along with media team for proper campaign set up and trackingParticipate in regular internal and client meetingsProactively bring new ideas to solve media and creative challenges, both big and smallActively participate in creative brainstorms when possible
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE2+ years agency experience planning and buying digital channels with increasing responsibility (e.g., ad agency media department, media company or client side)Strong attention to detail and analytical skillsAbility to maintain and meet client deadlinesIn-depth knowledge of Meta Ads Manager, TikTok Ads Manager, DCM, Sprout Social or a similar social content management platform.Experience working with influencers directly or through a third party provider Experience with Pinterest Ads, Snap Ads, Reddit Ads a plusKnowledge of traditional planning and billing systems a plusMicrosoft Office (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint)

Experience Level (if available): Associate
